Package javelin.model.item.artifact

Class Artifact

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.item.Item
      • javelin.model.item.artifact.Artifact
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AmuletOfHealth, BeltOfGiantStrength, CasterRing, CloakOfCharisma, CloakOfResistance, GlovesOfDexterity, GogglesOfNight, HeadbandOfIntellect, MantleOfSpellResistance, PeriaptOfWisdom, RingOfEnergyResistance, RingOfProtection, WingsOfFlying
    public abstract class Artifact
extends Item
    A special kind of item that is equipabble and is not allowed to be crafted on Towns but can be found on other occasions such as in a Caravans' possession, Chest chests and at the Arcane University. The name of this class is a big misnomer from d20 standards. Technically there are just non-consumable, passive normal magic items. They're supposed to be just a simple way to expand inventory management possibilities in a hopefully worthwhile yet simple manner. Since stacking bonuses is complicated on d20 a few items have been adapted to solve this with Slot types instead. Equipped artifacts are removed before applying an Upgrade and then re-equipped afterwards.
    See Also:
    Combatant.equipped, Serialized Form

      • equip

        public boolean equip​(Combatant c)
        Puts on an equipment piece, registering it at Combatant.equipped and activating it's effects. If this is already equipped will remove it, to work as well as a toggle on/off function.
        Parameters:
        c - Equipping unit.
        Returns:
        false if not Monster.humanoid, in which case the operation is aborted.
